trans-unit.source: Moving Average Filter
trans-unit.target: Moving Average Filter

trans-unit.source: Creates a moving average filter used to smooth data for trend analysis
trans-unit.target: Creates a moving average filter used to smooth data for trend analysis

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="529B4991-8A7F-4E12-8F36-51F9FACA4383" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Filter</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="529B4991-8A7F-4E12-8F36-51F9FACA4383" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Filter</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> module to calculate a series of one-sided or two-sided averages over a dataset, using a window length that you specify.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> module to calculate a series of one-sided or two-sided averages over a dataset, using a window length that you specify.

trans-unit.source: After you have defined a filter that meets your needs, you can apply it to selected columns in a dataset by connecting it to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.
trans-unit.target: After you have defined a filter that meets your needs, you can apply it to selected columns in a dataset by connecting it to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.

trans-unit.source: The module does all the calculations and replaces values within numerical columns with corresponding moving averages.
trans-unit.target: The module does all the calculations and replaces values within numerical columns with corresponding moving averages.

trans-unit.source: You can use the resulting moving average for plotting and visualization, as a new smooth baseline for modeling, for calculating variances against calculations for similar periods, and so on.
trans-unit.target: You can use the resulting moving average for plotting and visualization, as a new smooth baseline for modeling, for calculating variances against calculations for similar periods, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Moving Averages
trans-unit.target: Understanding Moving Averages

trans-unit.source: This type of average helps you reveal and forecast useful temporal patterns in retrospective and real-time data.
trans-unit.target: This type of average helps you reveal and forecast useful temporal patterns in retrospective and real-time data.

trans-unit.source: The simplest type of moving average starts at some sample of the series, and uses the average of that position plus the previous <math>n</math> positions instead of the actual value.
trans-unit.target: The simplest type of moving average starts at some sample of the series, and uses the average of that position plus the previous <math>n</math> positions instead of the actual value.

trans-unit.source: (You can define <math>n</math> as you like.)
trans-unit.target: (You can define <math>n</math> as you like.)

trans-unit.source: The longer the period <math>n</math> across which the average is computed, the less variance you will have among values.
trans-unit.target: The longer the period <math>n</math> across which the average is computed, the less variance you will have among values.

trans-unit.source: Also, as you increase the number of values used, the less effect any single value has on the resulting average.
trans-unit.target: Also, as you increase the number of values used, the less effect any single value has on the resulting average.

trans-unit.source: A moving average can be <newTerm>one-sided</newTerm> or <newTerm>two-sided</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: A moving average can be <newTerm>one-sided</newTerm> or <newTerm>two-sided</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: In a one-sided average, only values preceding the index value are used.
trans-unit.target: In a one-sided average, only values preceding the index value are used.

trans-unit.source: In a two-sided average, past and future values are used.
trans-unit.target: In a two-sided average, past and future values are used.

trans-unit.source: For scenarios in which you are reading streaming data, cumulative and weighted moving averages are particularly useful.
trans-unit.target: For scenarios in which you are reading streaming data, cumulative and weighted moving averages are particularly useful.

trans-unit.source: A <newTerm>cumulative moving average</newTerm> takes into account the points preceding the current period.
trans-unit.target: A <newTerm>cumulative moving average</newTerm> takes into account the points preceding the current period.

trans-unit.source: You can weight all data points equally when computing the average, or you can ensure that values nearer the current data point are weighted more strongly.
trans-unit.target: You can weight all data points equally when computing the average, or you can ensure that values nearer the current data point are weighted more strongly.

trans-unit.source: In a <newTerm>weighted moving average</newTerm>, all weights must sum to 1.
trans-unit.target: In a <newTerm>weighted moving average</newTerm>, all weights must sum to 1.

trans-unit.source: In an <newTerm>exponential moving average</newTerm>, the averages consist of a <newTerm>head</newTerm> and a <newTerm>tail</newTerm>, which can be weighted.
trans-unit.target: In an <newTerm>exponential moving average</newTerm>, the averages consist of a <newTerm>head</newTerm> and a <newTerm>tail</newTerm>, which can be weighted.

trans-unit.source: A lightly weighted tail means that the tail follows the head quite closely, so the average behaves like a moving average on a short weighting period.
trans-unit.target: A lightly weighted tail means that the tail follows the head quite closely, so the average behaves like a moving average on a short weighting period.

trans-unit.source: When tail weights are heavier, the average behaves more like a longer simple moving average.
trans-unit.target: When tail weights are heavier, the average behaves more like a longer simple moving average.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Moving Average Filter
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Moving Average Filter

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> module to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> module to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Specify the length of the filter.
trans-unit.target: Specify the length of the filter.

trans-unit.source: For a moving average, the length of the filter determines how many values are averaged in the sliding window.
trans-unit.target: For a moving average, the length of the filter determines how many values are averaged in the sliding window.

trans-unit.source: Specify the <ui>type</ui> of the moving average to compute.
trans-unit.target: Specify the <ui>type</ui> of the moving average to compute.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Add the dataset that has the values you want to compute a moving average for, and add the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.
trans-unit.target: Add the dataset that has the values you want to compute a moving average for, and add the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Connect the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> to the lefthand input of <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link>, and connect the dataset to the righthand input.
trans-unit.target: Connect the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> to the lefthand input of <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link>, and connect the dataset to the righthand input.

trans-unit.source: In the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module, use the Column Selector to specify which columns the filter should be applied to.
trans-unit.target: In the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module, use the Column Selector to specify which columns the filter should be applied to.

trans-unit.source: By default, the filter you create will be applied to all numeric columns, so be sure to exclude any columns that don’t have appropriate data.
trans-unit.target: By default, the filter you create will be applied to all numeric columns, so be sure to exclude any columns that don’t have appropriate data.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: At that point, the following operations are applied to the selected columns:
trans-unit.target: At that point, the following operations are applied to the selected columns:

trans-unit.source: For each set of values defined by the filter length parameter, the current (or index) value is replaced with the moving average value.
trans-unit.target: For each set of values defined by the filter length parameter, the current (or index) value is replaced with the moving average value.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details on how each is computed.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details on how each is computed.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> module using the following input parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the <ui>Moving Average Filter</ui> module using the following input parameters:

trans-unit.source: Length
trans-unit.target: Length

trans-unit.source: Type a positive whole number that indicates the filter length.
trans-unit.target: Type a positive whole number that indicates the filter length.

trans-unit.source: Longer filters are also called <newTerm>higher order</newTerm> filters, and provide a larger window of calculation and a closer approximation of the trend line.
trans-unit.target: Longer filters are also called <newTerm>higher order</newTerm> filters, and provide a larger window of calculation and a closer approximation of the trend line.

trans-unit.source: Shorter or <newTerm>lower order</newTerm> filters use a smaller window of calculation and more closely resemble the original data.
trans-unit.target: Shorter or <newTerm>lower order</newTerm> filters use a smaller window of calculation and more closely resemble the original data.

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Select the type of moving average to apply.
trans-unit.target: Select the type of moving average to apply.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides the following ways to define a moving average:
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides the following ways to define a moving average:

trans-unit.source: Simple
trans-unit.target: Simple

trans-unit.source: A simple moving average (SMA) is calculated as an unweighted rolling mean.
trans-unit.target: A simple moving average (SMA) is calculated as an unweighted rolling mean.

trans-unit.source: Triangular
trans-unit.target: Triangular

trans-unit.source: Triangular moving averages (TMA) are averaged twice for a smoother trend line.
trans-unit.target: Triangular moving averages (TMA) are averaged twice for a smoother trend line.

trans-unit.source: The word triangular is derived from the shape of the weights that are applied to the data, which emphasizes central values.
trans-unit.target: The word triangular is derived from the shape of the weights that are applied to the data, which emphasizes central values.

trans-unit.source: Exponential Simple
trans-unit.target: Exponential Simple

trans-unit.source: An exponential moving average (EMA) gives more weight to the most recent data.
trans-unit.target: An exponential moving average (EMA) gives more weight to the most recent data.

trans-unit.source: The weighting drops off exponentially.
trans-unit.target: The weighting drops off exponentially.

trans-unit.source: Exponential
trans-unit.target: Exponential

trans-unit.source: A modified exponential moving average calculates a running moving average, where calculating the moving average at any one point considers the previously computed moving average at all preceding points.
trans-unit.target: A modified exponential moving average calculates a running moving average, where calculating the moving average at any one point considers the previously computed moving average at all preceding points.

trans-unit.source: This method yields a smoother trend line.
trans-unit.target: This method yields a smoother trend line.

trans-unit.source: Cumulative
trans-unit.target: Cumulative

trans-unit.source: Given a single point and a current moving average, the cumulative moving average (CMA) calculates the moving average at the current point.
trans-unit.target: Given a single point and a current moving average, the cumulative moving average (CMA) calculates the moving average at the current point.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how filters are used in machine learning, see this experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how filters are used in machine learning, see this experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Filters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525732</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates all filter types, using an engineered waveform dataset.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Filters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525732</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates all filter types, using an engineered waveform dataset.
